para.text: Providing you understand that your image is both important and yet breakable you'll soon get used to working with it. The most important thing to remember is to save your image often, preferably at least once an hour (possibly more frequently when you are just starting out). You can save the image from the
menu command in all of the development tools or by clicking the camera "snapshot" toolbar button. You'll hear a shutter release sound to confirm that the image was saved successfully.

Because there is always the chance that you may inadvertently save down an image that has been corrupted in some hidden way over the top of a good image on disk, it is important that you also have a complete backup copy to fall back on. See
in the Reference section for more details on how to keep an appropriate backup.
